title: Seated Figure
credit_line: Gift of Aluminum Company of America
provenance_text:
Henri Laurens [1885-1954], Paris, France. Gimpel Fils, London, England [1]; G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, until June 26, 1965; G. David Thompson estate, June 1965-November 1966;  G. David Thompson sale, Parke-Bernet, New York, NY, March 23, 1966, no. 9 (not sold) [2]; The Aluminum Company of America, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1966 to October 19, 1967 [3]; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1967.

Notes:
[1]. Information from Mrs. G. David Thompson quoted in correspondence in curatorial file.
[2]. "The G. David Thompson Collection of Twentieth Century Paintings and Sculptures," March 23-24, 1966; this lot, titled "Femme Assise" and listed as executed in 1931, was included in the first day of the auction, on March 23, 1966. It was illustrated in the catalogue. 
[3]. Part of the Alcoa Collection of Contemporary Art.  See curatorial file for correspondence between Alcoa and the Marlborough-Gerson Gallery regarding an alternate title "L'Acrobat au Tapis" and the date of 1939. When the work was acquired from the G. David Thompson collection it was titled "Seated Figure", 1931.

creator.birth_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
